page.title: 17 Anchor head
page.content: Anchor Head is a rocky beach, it's a quite a big place. There are a lot of hotels like Anchor Head Hotel and Daunceys. About a hundred years ago the area was rented to Edward Baesh of Stanstead for 4d a year. An improvement scheme was started in in 1883 which included the construction of new walls from Anchor Head to the sanatorium.The dunes to south of the town were removed and some lawns were added and a boating slip. Other work included new carriage drives and a promenade together with shelters, public conveniences and fencing. The whole work cost about Â£35,000 more than Â£2 per head of population. Today Anchor Head is a popular place for tourists to sit in the sun. Westoners like to go crabbing there.
